description: Core cognitive psychology principles: attention, memory, learning, decision processes, and cognitive load. Structured for applied reasoning support.

theories.name: Working Memory Model
theories.oneLiner: Working memory has limited capacity and is responsible for short-term information manipulation.

faceExamples.title: Overloaded founder
faceExamples.scenario: User juggling multiple technical layers at once.

theories.name: Cognitive Load Theory
theories.oneLiner: Learning efficiency declines when intrinsic and extraneous load exceed processing capacity.

faceExamples.title: Documentation overload
faceExamples.scenario: User overwhelmed by too many moving system components.

intentSignals: why is this hard to learn

theories.name: Dual Process Theory
theories.oneLiner: Human reasoning operates through fast intuitive (System 1) and slow analytical (System 2) processes.
actionablePrinciples: Run a slow-pass review on major moves.

faceExamples.title: Reactive decision
faceExamples.scenario: User wants to pivot immediately after frustration.

theories.name: Metacognition
theories.oneLiner: Thinking about one's own thinking improves strategy and learning efficiency.

faceExamples.title: Overconfidence check
faceExamples.scenario: User believes they have mastered a domain quickly.

theories.name: Spaced Repetition
theories.oneLiner: Information retained better when exposure is spaced over time.
actionablePrinciples: Use retrieval practice instead of rereading.

faceExamples.title: Skill retention
faceExamples.scenario: User forgets system structures after short bursts.

theories.name: Attention Control Theory
theories.oneLiner: Anxiety and stress reduce attentional control and working memory efficiency.
actionablePrinciples: Stabilize emotional state before complex reasoning.

faceExamples.title: High-pressure launch
faceExamples.scenario: User under deadline cannot think clearly.

applicationRules.instruction: Use cognitive explanations as educational framing, not medical diagnosis.
When a theory is surfaced, include at least one actionable principle.
If cognitive load is high, simplify theory explanation.

meta.intendedUse: Cognitive reasoning support layer for Marion psychology domain.
